page.title: 02MENDIP PLATEAU-LANDSCAPE
page.content: The Mendips are a range of hills rising to about 350 metres.Earth movements have led to four major domes which have since been eroded exposing older rocks in their cores.The block is part of the{Mendip Plateau},a gently undulating area,mostly above 250 metres.It is cut by several shallow valleys. {Carboniferous Limestone}underlies much of the block.Many typical limestone features are found in the area,mainly as a result of chemical weathering by water. Swallets,scars,depressions,frequ ent rocky outcrops and the upper part of Cheddar gorge are characteristic of the surface landscape.Spectacular features are also found below ground in the{cave systems}of the block,notably Longwood Swallet and Manor Farm swallet.
